component.name: DLSS Updater
component.summary: Update DLSS, FSR, and XeSS DLLs for your games

description.p: DLSS Updater automatically detects and updates NVIDIA DLSS, AMD FSR, and Intel XeSS DLLs across your entire game library. It supports multiple game launchers including Steam, Epic Games, GOG Galaxy, Ubisoft Connect, EA Play, Battle.net, and Xbox Game Pass.

ul.li: Cross-platform support for Windows and Linux
Automatic detection of games from multiple launchers
Support for Steam Proton and Wine prefixes on Linux
Built-in backup system for restoring original DLLs
Updates for DLSS, FSR, XeSS, Ray Reconstruction, Frame Generation, and Streamline
Individual game updates for specific binaries
Custom folder support for games in non-standard locations

screenshot.caption: Main application window showing detected games

ul.li: Fix for progressive loading of games.
Adjustments to the default Linux flatpak permissions to read/write to allow writing by default.
Some upgrades to dependencies to fix CVE reports.
Phantom Game Cleanup: Uninstalled games are now automatically removed from the database on rescan
Version Format Normalization: DLL versions consistently display in dot-separated format
DLL Count Consistency: Fixed issue where updating custom folder games could reduce DLL count
MergedGame AttributeError: Fixed crash when using Update/Restore on duplicate game entries
Stale Version Display: DLL versions refreshed from filesystem before showing dialog
Database Cleanup: Automatic cleanup of duplicate games, backups, and orphan DLL records
Shutdown Progress Dialog: Visual feedback during app shutdown showing cleanup progress
Reduced navigation transitions from ~600ms to under 100ms (most views)
Content detachment: only the active view is serialized during page updates
Single page.update() per transition instead of 2 (no fade-out gap)
GamesView isolation: 500+ control subtree excluded from navigation updates
Hub/Settings transitions ~10x faster, Games transitions ~10-18x faster
Replaced tab-based navigation with a hub home screen
Added floating pill navigation bar shown when inside views
Navigation stack supports back navigation via Escape key
New Settings view for Update Preferences, UI Preferences, Blacklist, Theme
Removed standalone Backups tab (available per-game in Games view)
Upgraded Flet from 0.28.3 to 0.80.4 (major version jump)
Modernized entry point and API usage
Updated all UI components for new Flet patterns
Improved GIL unlock support for free-threaded Python 3.14

description.p: GUI Unresponsiveness Fix - Critical fix for frozen/unclickable UI

ul.li: Fixed LoadingOverlay blocking all input after hiding (caused frozen UI)
Removed darkdetect dependency that caused blocking startup on Linux/Wayland
Fixed admin elevation race condition causing dual process instances on Windows
Theme now loads from saved preference or defaults to dark mode
Enables the use of the light theme, found under Preferences
Bug fixes for memory leak issues
DLL's are now categorised under Games, for better legibility.

description.p: Linux Flatpak Fixes - Resolved multiple launch and scan issues

ul.li: Fixed FileNotFoundError when ~/.flet/bin directory doesn't exist (Issue #127)
Fixed OSError "Read-only file system" on Flatpak by ensuring Flet directories are created (Issue #122)
Added --filesystem=~/.flet:create permission to Flatpak build script
Fixed "Scan Failed" error caused by dict being passed as path (Issue #126)
Fixed GTK/SVG icon loading failures on Nobara 43 (libstdc++ CXXABI conflict)
Excluded system C++ libraries from PyInstaller bundle to use Flatpak runtime libraries
Added libxess_fg.dll (XeSS Frame Generation SDK v1.2.2.118)
Added libxell.dll (Intel XeLL library v1.2.1.13)
Updated libxess.dll and libxess_dx11.dll to v2.0.2.68
Intel XeSS Frame Generation provides AI-powered frame interpolation for Arc GPUs
Fixes for multiple drives having the same game, and fixes for sub-root detection of DLL's not merging correctly

description.p: Flatpak distribution replaces AppImage for improved Linux compatibility

ul.li: Flatpak package available on Flathub and GitHub Releases
Eliminates library compatibility issues across different Linux distributions
Consistent runtime environment with all dependencies included
In-app dialog guides users to grant permissions for custom game locations
AppImage distribution discontinued in favor of Flatpak
Removed sudo/root elevation support (Flatpak handles permissions)

description.p: DLSS SR Preset Override - GPU-based preset recommendations

ul.li: Configure DLSS Super Resolution presets (K/L/M) with automatic GPU detection
RTX 20/30 series recommended Preset K, RTX 40/50 series use Preset M or K
Preset L is heavier and may reduce performance
Windows: System-wide registry override for all games
Linux: Generate Steam launch options with copy-to-clipboard
First-time setup dialog appears automatically for NVIDIA GPU users
Re-configurable anytime via Preferences menu
Removed forced sudo/root requirement for Linux
App now runs in user space by default
System-level Wine/Proton paths skipped with warning banner
Most Steam Proton/Lutris games work without elevation
Cross-platform support for Windows and Linux
Steam Proton and Wine prefix detection on Linux
Bundled dependencies for standalone distribution
